faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Learn about the frequently asked questions about the B4OS 2025 program

1.question: Is B4OS really free? Are there hidden costs?
1.answer: Yes, B4OS is 100% free. There are no registration fees, paid materials, or hidden costs of any kind. The program is funded by the Satoshi Library to make professional-quality Bitcoin education accessible to Spanish-speaking developers.

2.question: Is all the developed code open source?
2.answer: Absolutely. All code developed as part of the B4OS program is open source and follows FOSS principles. Participants contribute to real open source projects in the Bitcoin ecosystem, including Bitcoin Core and Lightning Network.

3.question: What Bitcoin technologies are taught?
3.answer: B4OS focuses on Bitcoin Core and Lightning Network development. You'll learn P2P architecture, transaction validation, payment channels, and contribute to real projects. We only cover Bitcoin and its ecosystem.

4.question: Do I need previous experience programming Bitcoin?
4.answer: You don't need Bitcoin experience, but you do need solid programming knowledge. You should have experience with at least one language (Python, C++, Rust, JavaScript), Git, and command line. We'll teach you all the Bitcoin-specific content from scratch.

5.question: Is attending the residency mandatory?
5.answer: No, attending the residency is not mandatory. If you attend, you'll have the opportunity to meet other participants and mentors in person, work as a team, and learn from them.

6.question: How much time should I dedicate to the program weekly?
6.answer: We recommend 5-10 hours weekly during the program's duration. This will be distributed across time for Socratic seminars, preparatory readings, challenges, and development practice hours.

7.question: Are there things to consider for specialization?
7.answer: There will always be individual tasks during the program, whether it's research work, development, or delivering code challenges. If you're actively working on a specific project, you'll have the freedom to specialize, but you won't have the freedom to not work on a project.

8.question: Can I choose my learning path?
8.answer: Yes, after the first 5 weeks you can specialize by choosing between: Bitcoin Core Protocol Development, Lightning Network Development, or Application Development. Your mentor will help you choose according to your professional interests.

9.question: Are activities and challenges done in groups or individually?
9.answer: Activities and challenges are primarily done individually, but there are occasions when they will be done in groups. If you have questions, you can contact your mentor or the community in the Discord channel.

10.question: Are recordings of the sessions available?
10.answer: We do not record the seminars to maintain a safe and private learning environment. Instead, we provide detailed post-session summaries, supplementary study materials, and make-up sessions for special cases.

11.question: What technical tools do I need to install?
11.answer: We will provide the necessary environments to work on the various projects that will be developed during the program. If you need to install any tools locally, we will do it together.

12.question: What results can I expect upon completion?
12.answer: Tangible and verifiable achievements: Minimum of 3 accepted contributions to Bitcoin Core or Lightning Network, a functional personal project, direct connections with senior Bitcoin developers, and a verifiable certificate with your specific contributions.

13.question: How does B4OS connect me with job opportunities?
13.answer: Direct partnerships with Bitcoin companies: Guaranteed interviews for the top 20% of graduates, exclusive job board for students, personal references from mentors, and networking events with Bitcoin recruiters.

14.question: Are there geographic or age restrictions?
14.answer: There are no geographic restrictions. B4OS is open to developers from any country who speak Spanish. Minimum age: 18 years. Schedules are coordinated considering the diversity of time zones of the participants.

15.question: Where can I send feedback or report issues?
15.answer: Multiple channels available: Main email hola@b4os.dev, Discord community for direct chat, GitHub Issues for technical reports, and regular feedback sessions during the program.

header.title: B4OS 2025/26 - What you need to know
header.intro_1: Hey developer! Before joining this adventure, we want you to know exactly what to expect from the B4OS program.
header.intro_2: No confusing fine print - here's everything clear and straightforward.

about.title: What this is about
about.content_1: B4OS is a program designed for experienced devs who want to contribute to the Bitcoin, Lightning and Nostr ecosystem.
about.content_2: If you register, it means you unconditionally accept everything that follows.

process.title: The process:
process.content: We evaluate your application, your skills in the code challenges, and some internal criteria. Simple.

target.title: Who is this for?
target.content_1: We're looking for senior developers or those with enough experience to make real contributions to open source projects.
target.content_2: We reserve the right to decide who gets in (nothing personal, we just want the best fit for everyone).

phase1.title: Phase 1: Code Challenges
items: Period defined by us
Code exercises to showcase your skills
All asynchronous in GitHub Classroom
Communication through Discord

phase2.title: Phase 2: Portfolio + FOSS Contributions
phase2.intro: If you pass the challenges, you enter the good phase:
items: Actively contribute to open source projects (Bitcoin Core, Lightning Network, or Nostr)
Participate in group sessions and talks with guests
Communicate regularly with mentors and the team

tools.title: The tools we will use
items: Discord: For everything - support, community, questions
GitHub Classroom: For submitting and reviewing code
LMS Platform: For materials and resources

your_code.title: Your code:
your_code.content: Everything you contribute to FOSS projects follows the licenses of those projects. It's yours, we don't claim anything.

our_content.title: Our content:
our_content.content: The educational materials we provide are under Open Source licenses unless we tell you otherwise. Use them to learn during the program. Please do not publish the code challenges or results, these challenges take a lot of work and we ask you not to share them, please.

conduct.title: Code of conduct (aka "don't be toxic")
conduct.content: Remain professional and respectful in Discord, online sessions and events. Zero tolerance for harassment, discrimination or toxic behaviors.

scholarships.title: About scholarships and in-person residency

expectations.title: Realistic expectations:
expectations.content: The program does not guarantee scholarships or invitation to the residency. That depends on how you perform during the program.

scholarships.criteria: We work with clear criteria that we will communicate to you in a timely manner.

data.title: Your data
data.content_1: We need your data to manage the program. We process it according to our good privacy policies and respective laws.
data.content_2: We never share it with third parties without your permission.

communications.title: Communications
communications.content_1: By joining, you agree to receive updates about the program and the B4OS ecosystem: event invitations, new programs, relevant news.

changes.title: Changes to these terms
changes.content_1: To improve or adapt the program, we may update these terms when necessary. Changes are published on the program website. It is your responsibility to keep them in mind and stay up to date.

tldr.content: TL;DR: This is a serious program for serious devs who want to contribute to the Bitcoin/Lightning/Nostr ecosystem. Be professional, contribute code, learn a ton. No scholarship guarantees, but lots of growth potential.

conduct.page_description: Code of conduct for the B4OS community

header.title: Contributor Code of Conduct
header.intro: At B4OS we are committed to maintaining an inclusive, respectful, and professional learning environment for all participants in our program.

commitment.title: Our commitment, your commitment
commitment.content: In the interest of fostering an open and respectful environment, we commit to making participation in our community an inclusive experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, level of experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

items: Be kind and empathetic
Listen before speaking and yield the floor
Gracefully accept constructive criticism
Help without being condescending. Use respectful, kind, and inclusive language in all interactions
Respect opinions and experiences that differ from our own
Give others practical and constructive feedback when requested
Call people by their preferred names, nicknames, and pronouns
Assume the best intentions of others and approach with humility

unacceptable.title: Unacceptable behavior
items: Harassment
Asking for private information
Asking for money, Bitcoin / sats without approval from the Satoshi Library
Asking for investments, seed words or seed phrases
Using a name that is not yours trying to impersonate someone else. Ex: Craig impersonates Satoshi without being Satoshi
Conduct or speech that could be considered sexist, racist, misogynistic, homophobic, transphobic, or otherwise discriminatory or offensive in nature
Showing disrespect towards others (jokes, laughing at or mocking, insinuations, dismissive attitudes)
Using unwanted, suggestive, derogatory or inappropriate nicknames or terms
Antagonistic behavior, always wanting to fight or contradict to cause controversy
Spamming or self-promotion in inappropriate channels

sanctions.title: Sanctions and expulsions
sanctions.content: Any person who exhibits unacceptable behavior will lose all opportunities to be part of the B4OS program and the Libreria de Satoshi community. They will lose all opportunities to obtain completion certificates for any activity. They will lose all opportunities to obtain scholarships. They may be sanctioned and banned from the B4OS program, any course, and the Libreria community for 4 months.
